resources.string: Churches of Santiago Pasto, On March 13, 1894 the demolition of the ruinous temple of Santiago began; On the 20th of the same month and year the cornerstone of the new one was placed and on October 1st, 1897, Fray Ezequiel Moreno Díaz, Bishop of Pasto, solemnly inaugurated him, with the spiritual rectory of the Ecuadorian Capuchins, assiduously required and for whom I build the broad monastery

Churches of Las Lajas Pasto, Wonder for its medieval architecture and its topographic location between the cliffs of the Andes mountain range, which is why it is called as a miracle of God over the abyss

Churches of San Andres Pasto, The temple of San Andrés is located in one of the most traditional sectors of the city, known as RUMIPAMBA, which in Quichua means \"PLAIN OF STONE\". Rumipamba has been the scene of important events in the history of Pasto, such as the beheading in 1564 at the hands of the Spanish authorities, of the young Creole Gonzalo Rodríguez, who since the beginning of the colony, sought the independence of this territory

Churches of Fatima Pasto, it is ultra modernist Romanesque in its area is formed a broad Latin Cross, its unique altar occupies the center of the transept and at the top of the temple, supported by four spirally shaped columns, is the beautiful image of the Virgin of Fatima that illuminates its loving light. On the walls of the temple there is a series of large and elegant stained glass windows. The altar is an integral white slab on black marble bases. The light enters torrents and the iris of its wide stained glass windows play like an enchanted kaleidoscope

Churches of the Pasto Cathedral, the Cathedral of Pasto, also known as Temple of the Sacred Heart is a cathedral church of Catholic worship consecrated to the Sacred Heart of Jesus and San Francisco, located in the center of the city of Pasto

Iglesias de Cristo Rey Pasto ,El templo de Cristo Rey, en Pasto, fue levantado por los padres jesuitas luego de que decidieron echar abajo la iglesia de Santo Toribio, construida en 1572. Además de este espacio, se heredó de la comunidad dominica la imagen del Cristo de Sibundoy, adquirida en 1583, que es considerada como una de las joyas artísticas y religiosas del templo
